document.discussion_title: Anthony Joshua to defend IBF world heavyweight title on November 26, confirms Eddie Hearn
document.topic_text: Anthony Joshua to defend IBF world heavyweight title on November 26, confirms Eddie Hearn Anthony Joshua will make the second defence of his IBF world heavyweight title on November 26, Eddie Hearn has confirmed. The 26-year-old successfully defended the title for the first time with a seventh round stoppage against American boxer Dominic Breazeale at the O2 Arena back in June. There has been speculation surrounding Joshua’s next opponent but the venue is now the topic of much debate after promoter Hearn revealed he will not be fighting at the O2 Arena which has become something of a fortress for the Watford -born star. Hearn said: ‘November 26 is the date for your diary. We are... read more Anthony Joshua wins the IBF world heavyweight title with second-round KO of Charles Martin Anthony Joshua won the IBF world heavyweight title by beating American Charles Martin with a spectacular second-round knockout at the O2 Arena. The 26-year Briton started fast with a number of heavy blows in the opening round and Martin was knocked to... Metro , 10 April 2016 in Sport Anthony Joshua: Joe Joyce could surpass my Olympic achievements with Rio gold medal Joyce will fight the Frenchman Tony Yoka in the Olympic gold medal bout – Britain’s last chance to win a medal in Rio. Joshua famously won this title in London four years ago. He then turned professional and has remained undefeated in 17 fights,... Daily Express , Saturday, 22:14 in Sport Dillian Whyte targets June comeback and a rematch with Anthony Joshua, the new IBF world heavyweight... Dillian Whyte is targeting a June comeback as he bids to resurrect his career after shoulder surgery. The 27-year-old has not fought since he was stopped in the seventh round of his grudge match with Anthony Joshua in December. He injured his shoulder... Daily Mail , 10 April 2016 in Sport Anthony Joshua to defend his IBF world heavyweight title against Dominic Breazeale at the O2 Arena on June 25 Anthony Joshua MBE will defend his IBF world heavyweight title against unbeaten Dominic Breazeale at the O2 on June 25. Joshua took both the belt and unbeaten record of American Charles Martin at the same venue on April 9, and he'll be looking to end... Daily Mail , 25 April 2016 in Sport
